explanation: The report is correct. The function calls memcpy (a <string.h> routine covered by MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17) and performs indexed stores into the allocation without proving that the destination object is large enough. Two feasible out‑of‑bounds scenarios exist: (1) the initial memcpy of body_header (pos == 0) will overflow if body_dyn_size < MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(body_header); (2) when body_dyn_size is non‑zero but smaller than (header_len + footer_len) the subtraction in the filler loop bound (size_t is unsigned) underflows, producing a very large loop bound so the filler writes (body_dyn[pos + filler_pos]) and the final memcpy of the footer will write beyond the allocation. Either case results in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects passed to the string/memory functions and therefore violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17.
